alert.note: Alert for Baker; Bradford; Eastern Alachua; Gilchrist; Hamilton; Northern Columbia; Southern Columbia; Suwannee; Union; Western Alachua (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 4:29PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Gilchrist, Bradford, northern Alachua, Baker, Union, Columbia, Suwannee, southern Hamilton and south central Charlton Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 429 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Dowling Park, or 10 miles west of Live Oak, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph, penny size hail, excessive cloud-to-ground lightning, and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Excessive cloud-to-ground lightning is occurring. Locations impacted include... Lake City, Live Oak, Starke, Lake Butler, Keystone Heights, White Springs, Bell, Raiford, Worthington Spring and Ichetucknee Spring. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for northern and northeastern Florida...and southeastern Georgia.

area.areaDesc: Baker; Bradford; Eastern Alachua; Gilchrist; Hamilton; Northern Columbia; Southern Columbia; Suwannee; Union; Western Alachua
